item.description:
One end of the Granite Town Rail Trail starts behind the Department of Public Works Garage for Milford, NH. In Milford it extends for 2.95 miles crossing 3 roads and going under NH-101. Part of the trail follows along beside Great Brook. At the town line the rail trail extends another 4 miles into Brookline. We will be doing an approximately 5 mile round trip line hike (2.5 miles one way) Thus anyone wanting to turn back before the turnaround point can simply retrace the easy to follow route back to the start.

The first picture shows the Public Works Garage in Milford.  The second picture shows the sign on the garage on the right brick covered end of the building.  The sign in the third picture is just past the right end of the building where one enters to get to the rail trail parking lot.

Here is a link to a trail description and trail map for the part of the rail trail in Milford.  The trail continues for another 4 miles into Brookline:

http://www.svlt.org/Trails/TrailMap.asp?TownName=Milford&TrailName=Granite%20Town%20Rail%20Trail

 

For those with water dogs the first 0.66 of the trial runs right along Great Brook.  Although I doubt the strength of the current will be an issue, a wet dog if it is very cold that day might be.
item.how_to_find_us: Turn off of NH -101 to NH -13 N (South Street) in Milford. Proceed 0.6 miles on NH-13N to 283 South St. (Department of Pubic Works - Milford, NH). See picture. The trail head parking lot is just past the right end of the D. of P. W. building.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Granite Town Rail Trail 5 mile line hike (2.5 miles one way)
